revised_title: The Interconnection and Continuity of Scientific Endeavour: John Wilkins, John Ray, and Carl Linnaeus
tldr: This article explores the interconnection and continuity of scientific endeavour from the period of John Wilkins, John Ray, and Carl Linnaeus, focusing on their contributions to botanical taxonomy, nomenclature, and the history of science. These three figures represent the transition from medieval Aristotelian scholasticism to the new natural philosophy championed by Francis Bacon and the empiricism expounded by John Locke. Their works reveal an essentially modernistic outlook, enquiring, unsatisfied, and dynamic, with a strong emphasis on observation and experiment.
